From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From broma +‎ -ear.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /bɾomeˈaɾ/ [bɾo.meˈaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: bro‧me‧ar

Verb

[edit]

bromear (first-person singular present bromeo, first-person singular preterite bromeé, past participle bromeado)

  1. (intransitive) to joke, to kid (to do or say something for amusement)

2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
